title: Getting Started with React
excerpt: A beginner's guide to building UIs with React.js.
content:
React is a popular JavaScript library developed by Facebook for building user interfaces. It allows developers to create large web applications that can update and render efficiently in response to data changes. One of React's core concepts is the component-based architecture. Instead of writing one big HTML file, React encourages breaking the UI into reusable pieces called components. These components can manage their own state and be composed to build complex UIs. React uses a virtual DOM to optimize rendering performance. When data changes, React updates only the components that need re-rendering, making applications fast and responsive. To get started with React, you can use Create React App: ```bash npx create-react-app my-app cd my-app npm start ``` This command sets up a development environment with everything you need: React, Webpack, Babel, and more. React also supports JSX — a syntax extension that lets you write HTML-like code inside JavaScript: ```jsx const Welcome = () =>

Hello, React!

; ``` Overall, React is powerful, scalable, and widely used across the web industry. Whether you're building a small widget or a large application, React provides the tools to do it efficiently
